"The herring was sampled from commercial catches in fishery areas" (does this still count as wildlife exposure), sample preparation not known, but most likely whole fish/muscle? --> Agreed
Year of sampling unknown, for some fish muscle only, for some fish whole fish homogenised
6:2 FTUCA? -> Is this ok nomenclature, is it considered PFAS, NOT ON OUR LIST
C4-14 nomenclature - used internet, Confused whether sample location should be lake or country (especially if multiple lakes sampled.), appendix missing --> Country, not lake!
Tissue -> multiple tissues but only one investigated for PFAS --> one tissue (we only care about PFAs here)

Muscle tissues, short chain PFAAs have lower absorption potentials, longer PFAAs could transport to farther distance in horizontal direction along the water flow and infiltrate into deeper depths in vertical direction

We suggest that the size/age dependence of the PFAS concentration could be related to differing uptake kinetics of the chemicals as a response to an increased level of these substances in the environment after a major flood event
Fish livers were better indicators of PFAS than muscle

Largemouth bass with high PFAS concentrations exhibited changes in the expression of genes related to lipid metabolism, energy production, RNA processing, protein production/degradation and contaminant detoxification, all of which are consistent with biomarker responses observed in other studies with PFASs
